alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 8:54AM EDT until April 08 at 12:18PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. .Heavy rainfall from the storms on Tuesday combined with increased reservoir releases at Lake Greenwood will produce minor flooding downstream along the Saluda River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. The Saluda River Resort below the Highway 121 bridge will be impacted. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM EDT.
